explanation_composer.regulatory_rule_cue:
Route Adherence in Designated Shipping Lanes (applicable to cargo vessels navigating near major maritime corridors; spatial anchor: København – Oslo, Grenå - Halmstad)
Operational Protocol Rationale: Cargo vessels operating without hazardous cargo and within established shipping lanes typically maintain stable speed and heading while following predefined linear routes, consistent with standard navigation practices in regulated waters. The observed behavior—steady motion, minimal course deviation, and alignment between direction of travel and vessel heading—reflects routine autopilot use on open-sea segments where traffic separation schemes apply. This pattern is especially common in coastal transit zones where predictable trajectories enhance collision avoidance. Alternative behaviors such as sharp turns or variable speed profiles are unlikely, as they would suggest port approach or maneuvering, neither of which is indicated by the vessel’s static attributes or surrounding context.
'''
